intro: Phelipanche tzvelevii, commonly known as the Balkan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Phelipanche tzvelevii is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in some regions.
